q:
In Machine Learning, you are working on a project using an unsupervised clustering algorithm. You are using the silhouette score to find the performance of the algorithm. Which of the following combinations of the silhouette score and number of clusters will you select for the best result?

Options

  1. Silhoutte score = 0.6, Number of cluster = 2
  2. Silhoutte score = 0.8, Number of cluster = 3
  3. Silhoutte score = 0.4, Number of cluster = 4
In Machine Learning, which of the following is an unsupervised clustering algorithm?

In Machine Learning, you are working on a project using an unsupervised clustering algorithm. You are using the silhouette score for evaluating the performance of the algorithm. Determine the range of Silhouette's score.
In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised clustering algorithm. Which of the following methods will you use to measure the performance of an unsupervised learning algorithm?

In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised clustering algorithm. Before performing clustering analysis, you want to perform data cleaning and you have a very less number of data points. In this scenario, which of the following is an appropriate approach:

  1. Caping and flouring of variables 
  2. Removal of outliers

In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised algorithm called the k-means algorithm. One of the important steps in this algorithm is to determine the optimal number of clusters into which the data may be clustered. From the given graph find the value of K that represents the number of clusters:

In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised algorithm called k-means. If the algorithm is terminating, then which of the following can be the possible reasons for the termination:

  1. The number of iterations is fixed.
  2. The assignment of observations to clusters does not change between iterations.
  3. The algorithm has converged at the minima.
  4. It is terminated because RSS is falling below a threshold.

In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised clustering algorithm known as the expectation-maximization (EM) algorithm. The EM algorithm is an iterative method to find the maximum likelihood. In this scenario, which of the following statements about the algorithm are correct:

  1. It assumes that your data is composed of multiple multivariate normal distributions.
  2. It iteratively guess the distribution for the unobserved data.
  3. It minimizes the likelihood function when you have latent variables.

In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised clustering algorithm. You are using the silhouette coefficient to evaluate the clustering methods. If the silhouette coefficient of an observation is 0.9, then which of the following statements is correct?

a.option: The variance within the cluster is high.
The variance within the cluster is low.
Clusters are well apart from each other.
The observation is closer to its own cluster than to other clusters .

q:
In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised algorithm known as the k-means algorithm. One of the important steps in this algorithm is to determine the optimal number of clusters into which the data may be clustered. From the provided graph, find the value of K?

Graph

In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised algorithm known as the hierarchical clustering algorithm. Determine the correct order of the provided steps for the execution of the algorithm.

Steps

  1. Find the closest pair of clusters and merge them into a single cluster.
  2. Assigning each item to a cluster so that if you are given N items, then you have N clusters each containing just one item.
  3. Repeat the above two steps until all items are clustered into a single cluster of size N.
  4. Compute distances between the new cluster and each of the old clusters.

In Machine Learning, you are working on a problem and no labels are given to the learning algorithm thus allowing it to find the structure in its input. In this scenario, which of the following machine learning techniques will you use?

In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised learning algorithm called k-means clustering. Determine the correct order of the provided steps for the execution of the algorithm.

Steps

  1. Randomly initialize K points called cluster centroids.
  2. Assign other points which are closest to the cluster centroids.
  3. Move the cluster centroids to the mean of the points.
In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised algorithm. Which of the following methods can you use for evaluating the performance of an unsupervised clustering algorithm?

In Machine Learning, you are working on an unsupervised algorithm. The steps for the fuzzy k-means algorithm are provided. Arrange the steps in order for proper execution:

Steps

  1. Randomly initialize the k-means, \(\mu \lower 2pt{k}\), associated with the clusters and compute the probability that each data point \(x \lower 2pt{i}\) is a member of a provided cluster K.
  2. Assume a fixed number of clusters, K.
  3. Repeat until convergence.
  4. Recalculate the centroid of the cluster as the weighted centroid if the probabilities of membership of all data points \(x \lower 2pt{i}\) is \(\mu \lower 2pt{k} (n+1)= {\sum_{x \lower 2pt{i} \in k}x \lower 2pt{i} \times P(\mu \lower 2pt{k}|x \lower 2pt{i})^b \over \sum_{x \lower 2pt{i} \in k} P(\mu \lower 2pt{k}|x \lower 2pt{i})^b }\).
